Package core.profile

Class AStructuredProfile

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.profile.AProfile
      • core.profile.AStructuredProfile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IProfile
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ADHCPServerProfile, ADNSServerProfile, AFirewallProfile, AptSources, ChrootJessie, CiviCRM, Dedicated, Drupal7, Drupal8, DrupalCommons, EmailServer, Etherpad, Git, Grav, Horde, HyperVisor, HypervisorScripts, IPTablesFirewall, Jail, LEMP, LetsEncrypt, MariaDB, media, MISP, Msmtp, MSMTP, Nextcloud, Nginx, NodeJS, OnionBalance, OpenSocial, PHP, Piwik, Redmine, Router, Service, SMBServer, SSH, StrongSwan, SVN, Tor, Virtualisation, Webproxy, WebXRay, WebXRay, Wifi, Yourls
    public abstract class AStructuredProfile
extends AProfile
    This represents a fully-fledged profile, designed to hold the end-to-end configuration steps for something. Profiles are intended to "outsource" tasks to specialised Units or Profiles - Profiles, really, are aimed at holding _configuration_ rather than anything else. If you find yourself doing something more than once, think about whether you should really be building a Unit for it.

      protected Set<IUnit> getInstalled()
      This is units relating to installing software for this profile
      protected Set<IUnit> getLiveConfig()
      This is Units for configurations you expect to change regularly, e.g.
      protected Set<IUnit> getLiveFirewall()
      This is probably the firewall method you're looking for.
      protected Set<IUnit> getPersistentConfig()
      Expecting the configuration to change regularly? Put it in getLiveConfig()!
      protected Set<IUnit> getPersistentFirewall()
      You almost certainly mean getLiveFirewall().
      Set<IUnit> getUnits()
      Returns a Set of all units related to this profile.

      • getLiveConfig

        protected Set<IUnit> getLiveConfig()
                            throws AThornSecException

        Throws:

      • getPersistentFirewall

        protected Set<IUnit> getPersistentFirewall()
                                    throws AThornSecException
        You almost certainly mean getLiveFirewall(). Please put Units related to the persistent configuration of the firewall (e.g. adding a Device) here.
        Throws:
        AThornSecException

      • getLiveFirewall

        protected Set<IUnit> getLiveFirewall()
                              throws AThornSecException
        This is probably the firewall method you're looking for. This is for operations which only require a reload of the rules such as ingress, egress, opening ports, or etc. If you want to do configuration of the firewall (e.g. add a Device) please see getPersistentFirewall()
        Throws:
        AThornSecException
